result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason A Palms was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  The defendant is to have NO CONFRONTATIONAL CONTACT with K. Neumann, as named in the complaint.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason A Palms

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for warrant and commitment order with attached affidavit
Request for reduction in payment plan-Courts response
Court finds contempt, 90 days WC Jail-stayed. Must post $100 prior to release then $100/month starting Oct 1, 2016 and each month until paid
Waushara County Jail-Inmate request to the court
In WC Jail

1:35 pm case called. Defendant Jason A Palms in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on record. Argued sentence. Attorney Zamzow concurs.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:No Contest.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Argument by DA Blader. Argument by Attorney Zamzow. Statement by Defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: Impose 45 days WCJ, STAYED and places the defendant on probation for a period of 12 months. If revoked, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 2 days served. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No Confrontational contact with K. Neumann. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid witin 60 days or payment plan. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-26-2016 01:30 pm
from Atty Zamzow requesting a plea/sentencing hearing
Status conference at 02-03-2016 10:15 am

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court, appearing via telephone.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Zamzow one add'l STC requested to consider offer extended.  STC adjourned as requested.  Status conference scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 10:15 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is not to possess any weapons.
Status conference at 01-26-2016 09:25 am

Case Called @ 2:35 PM: Defendant Jason A Palms in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP received and entered.   Atty Zamzow believes that the victim did contact the DA's office regarding no  contact provisions.  Court will amend terms of no contact with victim to no further argumentative contact.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 09:25 am.
Initial appearance at 12-29-2015 02:30 pm

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No possession of any weapons.
Defendant, pro se

Case Called @ 11:29 AM: Defendant Jason A Palms in court, in custody, appears via video, pro se.  Stephanie M. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def did not want services of SPD today.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel - Def will look further into obtaining counsel.  Def advised that he may retain own counsel or again contact the SPD office for representation.   Argument by ADA as to $1000 Signature Bond w/conditions.  Statement as to bond by Def - no arguments with bond, however resides at the home w/victim.  Further argument by ADA as to no contact provisions of bond.  The Court:  Sensitive to the conditions of bond and living arrangments. Orders Signature Bond w/conditions as requested.     IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Absent contact by the victim directly with the  DA's Office, the no contact provision will remain as ordered.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
